SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.actors

Class Health

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.actors.Health
public class Health extends Object
Health class manages the health of an object. Responsible for tracking health, taking damage, and checking if health is zero or less.

    • health

      private int health

  • Constructor Details

    • Health

      public Health(int initialHealth)
      Constructor to initialize the Health component with a specific initial health value.
      Parameters:
      initialHealth - The initial health value to be set for the object. Must be a non-negative integer.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if initialHealth is negative

  • Method Details

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage()
      Reduces the health of the object by one. Ensures that health does not go below zero.

    • isZero

      public boolean isZero()
      Checks if the health of the object has reached zero or less.
      Returns:
      True if the current health is zero or less, otherwise false.

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Retrieves the current health value of the object.
      Returns:
      The current health value as an integer.

    • increaseHealth

      public void increaseHealth(int healthToAdd)
      Increases the health of the object by a specified value. Ensures that the health value remains within a valid range.
      Parameters:
      healthToAdd - The amount of health to add. Must be a positive integer.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if healthToAdd is negative

    • resetHealth

      public void resetHealth(int newHealth)
      Resets the health of the object to a specified value.
      Parameters:
      newHealth - The new health value to reset to. Must be a non-negative integer.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if newHealth is negative

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks if the object is "alive" (health greater than zero).
      Returns:
      True if the current health is greater than zero, otherwise false.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides the toString method to provide a string representation of the current health state.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representing the current health value.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Example main method to demonstrate the usage of the Health class. This is optional and can be removed in production.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (not used)
